definition[0]: a small piece of rubber with a handle, used for printing dates or names on paper
definition[1]: to give official approval to something without really thinking about it â€“ used to show disapproval
example[0]: The committee has already rubber-stamped the scheme.
definition[2]: to give official approval to something without really thinking about it
example[1]: Consultants getting a company pay cheque are likely to rubber-stamp all management decisions without question.
definition[3]: a small piece of rubber with a handle, used for printing dates or names on documents
definition[4]: the person or thing that provides the official approval for something to happen
example[2]: The legislature is essentially a rubber stamp for the actions of a powerful political executive.
